conclusion: The plates carry charges +Q and –Q, and the field between the plates is uniform for an ideal parallel-plate capacitor.
The electric field E between the plates is given by E = σ/ε₀ = Q/(A ε₀).
The capacitance of the capacitor is C = ε₀A/d.
Rearranging the capacitance formula gives A = Cd/ε₀.
Substitute A = Cd/ε₀ into the expression for the field to get E = Qd /(C ε₀²).
Cancel one ε₀ to obtain E = Qd /(C ε₀).
A point charge q placed anywhere between the plates feels a force F = qE.
The magnitude of the force is F = q · Qd /(C ε₀).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force on the charge q is F = (qQd) / (C ε₀).
